error.signature: Error: Instance cannot be destroyed: resource has lifecycle.prevent_destroy set
error.regex: (Instance cannot be destroyed|prevent_destroy .+ is set|lifecycle .+ prevent_destroy|Resource .+ has lifecycle .+ prevent_destroy)

verdict.summary: Terraform plan includes destroying a resource that has prevent_destroy lifecycle rule enabled.

dead_ends.action: Use terraform destroy -target to bypass prevent_destroy
dead_ends.why_fails: The -target flag does not override lifecycle rules; prevent_destroy still blocks the destroy

dead_ends.action: Modify the state file directly to remove the resource
dead_ends.why_fails: Direct state modification is error-prone and the resource still exists in the cloud, creating drift

workarounds.action: Remove or set prevent_destroy = false before destroying
workarounds.how: Update the lifecycle block: lifecycle { prevent_destroy = false }, then run terraform apply, then destroy

workarounds.action: Use terraform state rm to remove from state without destroying the actual resource
workarounds.how: terraform state rm RESOURCE_ADDRESS removes the resource from Terraform management without destroying it in the cloud

leads_to.condition: After state rm, re-creating the resource fails because it still exists

preceded_by.condition: Moving a resource that has prevent_destroy triggers the lifecycle check

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Resource already exists is about cloud-side conflicts; prevent_destroy is a Terraform-side safety mechanism
